mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Betsey Mason to James Hollingsworth, 1872 (Tuesday the 10th)
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mason, Betsey (Elizabeth Price), 1802-1873
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Betsey Mason, Vice Regent for Virginia, to James Hollingsworth, Superintendent, 1872. Tuesday the 10th. In his note he did not mention the note she sent enclosing $5 for the MVLA. She needs the Regent's signature for funds but does not know where she is. Wants to know if she has decided to stay away from Mount Vernon. Discusses her dislike of Miss McMakin and Miss Cunningham's retirement. ER-14, p. 61
